revised_title: The Nature and Size of Luminescent Centers in Solid Solutions
tldr: This article investigates the relationship between the brightness of luminescence and the concentration of activators in solid solutions. The authors propose that the luminescent center consists of a definite number of solvent molecules associated with one molecule of the activator. They develop a theory and provide experimental evidence to support their findings, which can help explain the existence of an optimum concentration for luminescence.
